result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.

Defendant James M Burke in court with attorney Stephen Donald Willett.  Defendant James M Burke in custody, but in plain clothes.  John Michael O'Boyle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Day 2 of Jury Trial
8:21 Court in session.  
8:23 James Burke called, sworn and direct by Court regarding whether he will testify.  Defendant waives testifying today.  Court accepts waiver as knowingly, freely and voluntarily.  
Jury instructions reviewed.  Jury instruction 255A will be added to packet.  Special verdict form is approved by State and Defense.  8:31 Court recesses.
8:36 Court resumes with jury.
8:37 Lindsey Zenkowich, Barron County Department of Health and Human Services ongoing child protection social worker, called, sworn and direct by Attorney Willett.  
9:06 Cross by State.  9:18 Redirect by Attorney Willett.
Exhibit 8 - Document from DHHS - marked for identification by Attorney Willett..
9:27 Jury excused to address issue outside of their presence. 
C. Rand, Clerk
9:28 a.m. Attorney Willett relates.  State relates.  Court relates and objection sustained.
9:36 a.m. Court adjourns for 5 minute break.
9:45 a.m. Jurors seated.  Re-Direct by Attorney Willett resumes.
9:48 a.m. sidebar
9:50 a.m. Jurors excused to address issue outside of their presence.
10:00 a.m. Jurors seated.
10:02 a.m. D.W. called and sworn.  Direct by Attorney Willett.
10:07 a.m. Cross by State.
10:16 a.m. Jurors excused to address issue outside of their presence.
10:24 a.m. Jurors seated.  Re-Cross by State resumes.
10:29 a.m. Re-direct by Attorney Willett.
10:32 a.m. Jurors excused to address issue outside of their presence.
10:34 a.m. Jurors seated.
10:35 a.m. Attorney Willett advises he wants to make a motion outside the presence of the Jury.
10:36 a.m. Jurors excused.  Attorney Willett makes motion on a mistrial.  State relates.  Court relates denies motion.
10:59 a.m. John C. White, Investigator, called and sworn.  Direct by Attorney Willett.
11:04 a.m. Cross by State.
11:15 a.m. Court reviews Jury Instructions with counsel. 
11:33 a.m. Jurors seated.  Defense rests. 
11:34 a.m. Court reads Jury Instructions.
11:44 p.m. Jurors excused for lunch.
12:48 p.m. Jurors seated.
12:48 p.m. Closing argument by State.
1:09 p.m. Closing argument by Attorney Willett.
1:39 p.m. Rebuttal by State.
1:47 p.m. Court instructs the Jury.
1:50 p.m. Bailiff Sworn.
1:51 p.m. Jurors excused for deliberation.
2:44 p.m. Jurors seated and have a verdict.
Court reads Jury verdict as Guilty.
2:47 p.m. Jurors excused.
Court grants judgment on verdict and finds Defendant guilty. PSI ordered.  SEH set for 11/6/17 at 2:00 p.m.
Court revokes bond.
and peremptory challenges.

8:10 a.m. Defendant James M Burke in court with attorney Stephen Donald Willett and John White, Investigator.  Defendant James M Burke in custody.  John Michael O'Boyle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Detective Mary Dexter with the Barron County Sheriffs Dept also present.
Court addresses issues of witness lists.  State relates on witness list.   Attorney Willett relates on witness list.  Court relates on Jury selection, voir dire and the court questioning the jurors.  State and Attorney Willett do not object. Court relates on Jury instructions and will read preliminary instructions while State and Attorney Willett make their strikes.  Court relates that that the Jury can take notes and will not have transcripts available. 
State relates on Forensic 3:Psychologist Hollida Wakefield's testimony.   Court adjourns at 8:27 a.m. 
S. Millermon, clerk
8:42 20 jurors seated.  8:44 All jurors sworn.  8:45 Court voir dire.  9:24 State voir dire.  9:36 Defense voir dire.  9:43 Court follow up voir dire.  9:43 Peremptory strikes made and Court gives preliminary jury instructions.  9:54 12 jurors sworn.  Jurors excused.  9:55  No objection to panel by State or Defense.  9:57 Court recesses. 
C. Rand, clerk
10:23 a.m. Court resumes.  State and Attorney Willett relate they have no other issues to discuss with the court before the Jury enters.
10:27 a.m. Jurors seated.
10:28 a.m. Court advises the Jury on opening instructions.
10:29 a.m. Opening by State.
10:39 a.m. Detective Mary Dexter called and sworn.  Direct by State.
10:45 a.m. Exhibits 1,2,3,4 - Photographs - Offered by State - Received by Court.
10:51 a.m. Cross by Attorney Willett.  Objection by State on hearsay. 
10:53 a.m. Jurors excused.  Argument by Attorney Willett on victim's statements to Detective Dexter.  Court sustains Objection due to hearsay rule.
10:59 a.m. Jurors seated.  Cross by Attorney Willett resumes.  Objection by State on hearsay.  
11:01 a.m. Jurors excused. Argument by Attorney Willett on allowing Detective Dexter to testify on police records.  Court sustains Objection due to hearsay rule.
11:16 a.m. Jurors seated.  Cross by Attorney Willett resumes. 
11:25 a.m. Exhibits 5,6,7 - Police records - Discussed by Attorney Willett, but not offered to the Court. 
11:26 a.m. Jurors excused.  Argument by Attorney Willett on allowing Detective Dexter to testify on police records.  Objection by State on hearsay.  Court sustains Objection due to hearsay rule.
11:34 a.m. Jurors seated.  
11:34 a.m. Re-direct by State.
11:35 a.m. D.B. called and sworn.  Direct by State.
12:08 p.m. Court adjourns for a break for lunch until after 1:00 p.m.
1:03 p.m. Court back on the record on State's motion for witnesses to be sequestered.  Attorney Willett relates.  Court relates and all witnesses are excluded from the trial and sequestered.
1:15 p.m. Jurors seated.
1:16 p.m. D.B. still called.  Direct by State continued.
1:22 p.m. Cross by Attorney Willett.
2:25 p.m. Re-Direct by State.
2:31 p.m. Re-Cross by Attorney Willett.
2:35 p.m. Re-Direct by State.
2:37 p.m. Court adjourns for 10 minute break.
2:52 p.m. Jurors seated.  Court resumes.
2:53 p.m. T.P. called and sworn.  Direct by State.
3:18 p.m. Cross by Attorney Willett.
3:31 p.m. Re-Direct by State.
3:34 p.m. Re-Cross by Attorney Willett.
3:35 p.m. Re-Direct by State.
3:35 p.m. State rests.
3:36 p.m. Jurors excused for 10 minute break.
Court addresses Attorney Willett on any motions.  Attorney Willett moves for Directive Verdict on grounds there is insufficient evidence to conform with requirements of the law.  Argument by State.  Court denies motion.
3:42 p.m. Jurors seated.
3:42 p.m. Opening by Attorney Willett.
3:51 p.m. Forensic Psychologist Hollida Wakefield called and sworn.  Direct by Attorney Willett.
4:01 p.m. Cross by State.
4:03 p.m. Detective Dexter Re-called and remains under oath.  Re-cross by Attorney Willett.
4:12 p.m. Re-Direct by State.
4:15 p.m. Court instructs Jurors and that they are to be back tomorrow morning.
Attorney Willett relates on mistrial to expert testimony.  State relates there is no basis for mistrial.  Court relates there was no need for expert testimony in this case.
4:22 p.m. Court adjourns for today and Jury Trial to resume tomorrow, 8/30/17.
